abstract.p:
An apparatus for diagnosing a breathing disorder of a patient that includes a first sensing system that determines a dimension, such as cross-sectional area, of a portion of the patient's airway and a second sensing system that determines an internal load on the airway.
A processing system receives the output from the first and second sensing systems and determines a compliance curve that corresponds to a relationship between the measured dimension and a plurality of internal loads on the patient's airway.
The processing system also determines at least one characteristic associated with the compliance curve.
This characteristic is indicative of a likelihood that the patient suffers from a breathing disorder.
